org.flemil.ui.component
Class ScreenWindow

java.lang.Object
  org.flemil.ui.component.ScreenWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
Item, Window
public class ScreenWindow
extends java.lang.Object
implements Window

Class that represent a Main application window that spans the whole display area available to the application

Author:
Solomon Kariri

isFocusible

public boolean isFocusible()
Description copied from interface: Item
Checks whether this Item can be set as the currently focused Item. This means that this Item should be able to adjust its behavior or look and feel in response to calls to its focusGained() or focusLost() methods

Specified by:
isFocusible in interface Item
Returns:
true if can be focused and false otherwise
See Also:

public void setFocusible(boolean focusible)
Description copied from interface: Item
Sets whether this Item should be focusable. This if passed the value true, then this Item will change its effects when being drawn to respond to focus gain and focus loss events

setPaintBorder

public void setPaintBorder(boolean paintBorder)
Description copied from interface: Item
Used to specify whether this Item should paint its border or not. If set true the Item will paint its border and not otherwise. All borders are painted one pixel wide and might be rounded at the edges depending on the Style settings of the application

Specified by:
setPaintBorder in interface Item
Parameters:
paintBorder - sets whether this Item should paint its border.

public void keyReleasedEventReturned(int keyCode)
Description copied from interface: Item
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a keyReleased event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it.

pointerPressedEventReturned

public void pointerPressedEventReturned(int x,
                                        int y)
Description copied from interface: Item
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a pointerPressed event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application

Specified by:
pointerPressedEventReturned in interface Item
Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer

pointerDraggedEventReturned

public void pointerDraggedEventReturned(int x,
                                        int y)
Description copied from interface: Item
Invoked by a child of this Item if it cannot handle a pointerDragged event passed to it. The parent then deals with the event if it can or propagates it to its parent if any if it cannot handle it. The coordinates are relative to the whole display area of the application and not this Item. To know whether the coordinate falls within its displayRect it can call the Rectangle.contains() method with the coordinates as the parameters.

Specified by:
pointerDraggedEventReturned in interface Item
Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the pointer
y - the y coordinate of the pointer
See Also:
Item.getDisplayRect()

                                int y)
Description copied from interface: Item

repaint

public void repaint(Rectangle clip)
Description copied from interface: Item
Repaints the given region of this Item. Mostly all calls to this method will result in the propagation of the call to the parent of this Item until the bottom most Item is reached so that all Items whose displayRectanges are intersected by the repainted rectangles repaints the intersects as well

Specified by:
repaint in interface Item
Parameters:
clip - the clip region that is to be repainted

getMenu

Description copied from interface: Window
Returns the Menu that is associated with this Window. Every Window Must have a Menu associated with it.

Specified by:
getMenu in interface Window
Returns:
the Menu that is associated with this Window.

paint

public void paint(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g,
                  Rectangle clip)
Description copied from interface: Item
Paints the region of this Item specified by the clip. The Item makes calculations to reduce as much as possible the area that is repainted for the Item. If the clip does not intersect in any way with this Items displayRectangle, then the Item is not painted at all.

Specified by:
paint in interface Item
Parameters:
g - the graphics on which the painting is to be done
clip - the region of the graphics that requires update or that is to be painted on by this Item

Description copied from interface: Item

Parameters:

setParent

public void setParent(Item parent)
Description copied from interface: Item
Sets the parent for this Item which also have to be an Item. This reference to the parent will be used to provide features most of which is the scrolling callback to notify the parent container of a scrolling action.

Specified by:
setParent in interface Item
Parameters:
parent - the Item in which this Item is placed. null if this Item is the topmost Item

setFullScreenMode

public void setFullScreenMode(boolean fullScreen)
Sets whether this Windows should be displayed in fullscreen or not. Setting this window to display in fullscreen mode hides the MenuBar and the title of the window such that the contentPane of this window occupies the whole available display area for this application

Parameters:
fullScreen - true to switch to fullscreen mode and false otherwise

isFullScreenOn

public boolean isFullScreenOn()
Checks whether this ScreenWindow is currently in fullscreen mode or not

Returns:
true if this ScrennWindow is currently in fullscreen mode and false otherwise

getMenuBarRect

public Rectangle getMenuBarRect()
Description copied from interface: Window
Returns the bar Rectangle that is used for displaying this Window's Menu. The bar does not have to belong to this window and it can be the bar for a parent to this window as is the case for PopupWindow

Specified by:
getMenuBarRect in interface Window
Returns:
the bar Rectangle that is used for displaying this Window's Menu.

getTitle

public java.lang.String getTitle()
Description copied from interface: Window
Sets the title for this Window. If the title is long enough not to fit within the available width of the window, the window will scroll the title automatically when it is displayed so that the whole title is readable by the user.

Specified by:
getTitle in interface Window
Returns:
the title for this Window.

setTitle

public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
Description copied from interface: Window
Sets the title for this Window.If the title is long enough not to fit within the available width of the window, the window will scroll the title automatically when it is displayed so that the whole title is readable by the user.

Specified by:
setTitle in interface Window
Parameters:
title - the title to be used this Window.

showPopUp

public void showPopUp(PopUpWindow window)
Show the PopupWindow passed as a parameter to this window on top of this Window. A screen window can have more than one popup added to it but only one can be displayed at a time. The most recent PopupWindow to be shown is the one that shows and when it disappears the one that had come before it is displayed. In shor the PopupWindows are displayed in a last added currently shown manner

Parameters:
window - the PopupWindow to be displayed

hidePopup

public void hidePopup(PopUpWindow popupWindow)
Removes and hides the specified popup window from the list of popup windows for this ScreenWindow

Parameters:
popupWindow - the Popup window to be hidden

menuRightSelected

public void menuRightSelected()
Description copied from interface: Window
Method that is called when the right item of the menu bar for this window is selected. This might be the right soft key or not depending on the current orientation of the application. The window does not need to care about which key it is but should only respond to the fact that the right key for the MenuBar has been selected.

Specified by:
menuRightSelected in interface Window

menuLeftSelected

public void menuLeftSelected()
Description copied from interface: Window
Method that is called when the left item of the menu bar for this window is selected. This might be the left soft key or not depending on the current orientation of the application. The window does not need to care about which key it is but should only respond to the fact that the left key for the MenuBar has been selected.

Specified by:
menuLeftSelected in interface Window

getCurrentPopup

public PopUpWindow getCurrentPopup()

public boolean isFocussed()
Specified by:
isFocussed in interface Item
